thread.title: 600g baby born on cruise ship beats odds to survive
thread.title_full: 600g baby born on cruise ship beats odds to survive | News24

author: news24.com
title: 600g baby born on cruise ship beats odds to survive
text:
Salt Lake City - A Utah woman who unexpectedly gave birth on a cruise ship months before her due date says she wrapped towels around the 600g boy and, with the help of medical staff, managed to keep him alive until the ship reached port.
Emily Morgan, of Ogden, said on Thursday that doctors didn't expect her son Haiden to live, but thanks to strong lungs, a makeshift incubator and an early arrival in Puerto Rico, the baby made it. He's now receiving care at a neonatal intensive care unit in Miami.
Morgan, aged 28, said the baby was due in December, but contractions began on August 31 during a seven-day cruise around the eastern Caribbean. Her doctor approved the cruise to celebrate her daughter's third birthday, Morgan said.
The pregnancy had been uneventful, so she was shocked when the contractions began just past the halfway mark in her pregnancy. She thought they might be false labour.
